com.example.ecom.controller

Class CustomerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.ecom.controller.CustomerController

  • public class CustomerController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class for managing customer-facing operations such as registration, login, product browsing, cart management, and order processing in the e-commerce application.

    This controller handles various HTTP endpoints for customer functionalities, such as viewing products, adding to cart, managing cart items, placing orders, viewing order history, and account actions like login and registration.

    Since:
    2025-06-07

      • validEmail

        public boolean validEmail(java.lang.String mail)
        Validates the email format and checks if it belongs to an allowed domain such as, "gmail.com", "yahoomail.com" or "rediffmail.com".
        Parameters:
        mail - Email string.
        Returns:
        True if valid, false otherwise.

      • RegisterCustomer

        public java.lang.String RegisterCustomer(java.lang.String cname,
                                         java.lang.String cmail,
                                         java.lang.String cpass,
                                         java.lang.String confpass,
                                         ModelMap model)
        Handles customer registration and validates input credentials. Password is encoded and saved if validation succeeds.
        Parameters:
        cname - Customer name.
        cmail - Customer email.
        cpass - Customer password.
        confpass - Confirm password.
        model - Model for passing attributes.
        Returns:
        Registration page view.

      • LoginCustomer

        public java.lang.String LoginCustomer(java.lang.String cmail,
                                      java.lang.String cpass,
                                      ModelMap model,
                                      HttpSession session,
                                      HttpServletRequest request)
        Handles customer login by verifying credentials and establishing a session.
        Parameters:
        cmail - Email.
        cpass - Password.
        model - Model.
        session - HTTP session.
        request - HTTP request.
        Returns:
        Home page if success, login page with error otherwise.
